post.description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new alert.**

Alerts allow you to specify an email address to receive notifications regarding your email usage or statistics. There are two types of alerts that can be created with this endpoint:

* `usage_limit` allows you to set the threshold at which an alert will be sent.
* `stats_notification` allows you to set how frequently you would like to receive email statistics reports. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

For more information about alerts, please see our [Alerts documentation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/alerts/).

type.description:
The type of alert you want to create. Can be either usage_limit or stats_notification.
Example: usage_limit

email_to.description:
The email address the alert will be sent to.
Example: test@example.com

frequency.description:
Required for stats_notification. How frequently the alert will be sent.
Example: daily

percentage.description:
Required for usage_alert. When this usage threshold is reached, the alert will be sent.
Example: 90

created_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was created.

email_to.description: The email address that the alert will be sent to.

frequency.description: If the alert is of type stats_notification, this indicates how frequently the stats notifications will be sent. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

updated_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was last modified.

percentage.description: "If the alert is of type usage_limit, this indicates the percentage of email usage that must be reached before the alert will be sent.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your alerts.**

Alerts allow you to specify an email address to receive notifications regarding your email usage or statistics. 
* Usage alerts allow you to set the threshold at which an alert will be sent.
* Stats notifications allow you to set how frequently you would like to receive email statistics reports. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

For more information about alerts, please see our [Alerts documentation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/alerts/).

created_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was created.

email_to.description: The email address that the alert will be sent to.

percentage.description: If the alert is of type usage_limit, this indicates the percentage of email usage that must be reached before the alert will be sent.

updated_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was last modified.

frequency.description: If the alert is of type stats_notification, this indicates how frequently the stats notifications will be sent. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

parameters.name: alert_id
parameters.description: The ID of the alert you would like to retrieve.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific alert.**

Alerts allow you to specify an email address to receive notifications regarding your email usage or statistics. 
* Usage alerts allow you to set the threshold at which an alert will be sent.
* Stats notifications allow you to set how frequently you would like to receive email statistics reports. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

For more information about alerts, please see our [Alerts documentation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/alerts/).

created_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was created.

email_to.description: The email address that the alert will be sent to.

frequency.description: If the alert is of type stats_notification, this indicates how frequently the stats notifications will be sent. For example: "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

updated_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was last modified.

percentage.description: If the alert is of type usage_limit, this indicates the percentage of email usage that must be reached before the alert will be sent.

delete.description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete an alert.**

Alerts allow you to specify an email address to receive notifications regarding your email usage or statistics. 
* Usage alerts allow you to set the threshold at which an alert will be sent.
* Stats notifications allow you to set how frequently you would like to receive email statistics reports. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

For more information about alerts, please see our [Alerts documentation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/alerts/).

patch.description:
**This endpoint allows you to update an alert.**

Alerts allow you to specify an email address to receive notifications regarding your email usage or statistics. 
* Usage alerts allow you to set the threshold at which an alert will be sent.
* Stats notifications allow you to set how frequently you would like to receive email statistics reports. For example, "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

For more information about alerts, please see our [Alerts documentation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/alerts/).

email_to.description:
The new email address you want your alert to be sent to.
Example: test@example.com

frequency.description:
The new frequency at which to send the stats_notification alert.
Example: monthly

percentage.description:
The new percentage threshold at which the usage_limit alert will be sent.
Example: 90

created_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was created.

email_to.description: The email address that the alert will be sent to.

frequency.description: If the alert is of type stats_notification, this indicates how frequently the stats notifications will be sent. For example: "daily", "weekly", or "monthly".

updated_at.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the alert was last modified.

percentage.description: If the alert is of type usage_limit, this indicates the percentage of email usage that must be reached before the alert will be sent.

address2.description: The second line of the user's address.

company.description: The name of the user's company.

patch.description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current profile details.**

Any one or more of the parameters can be updated via the PATCH `/user/profile` endpoint. You must include at least one when you PATCH.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your user account details.**

Your user's account information includes the user's account type and reputation.

type.description: The type of account for this user.

reputation.description: The sender reputation for this user.

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve the email address currently on file for your account.**

email.description: The email address currently on file for your account.

put.description: **This endpoint allows you to update the email address currently on file for your account.**

email.description: The new email address that you would like to use for your account.
The current email address on file for your account.

get.description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current account username.**

user_id.description: The user ID for your account.

put.description: **This endpoint allows you to update the username for your account.**

username.description: The new username you would like to use for your account.
The current username on file for your account.

get.description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the current credit balance for your account.**

Each account has a credit balance, which is a base number of emails it can send before receiving per-email charges. For more information about credits and billing, see [Billing and Plan details information](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/account-and-settings/billing/).

remain.description: The remaining number of credits available on your account.

total.description: The total number of credits assigned to your account.

overage.description: The number of overdrawn credits for your account.

used.description: The number of credits that you have used.

last_reset.description: The date that your credit balance was last reset.

next_reset.description: The next date that your credit balance will be reset.

reset_frequency.description: The frequency at which your credit balance will be reset.

put.description: **This endpoint allows you to update your password.**

new_password.description: The new password you would like to use for your account.

old_password.description: The old password for your account.
